intro: Durandea neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia durandea, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia in the Pacific Ocean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
